markdownRemark.html:
At Sāvatthī.

“Mendicants, the arising of craving for sights … craving for thoughts … is the manifestation of old age and death. The cessation of craving for sights … craving for thoughts … is the ending of old age and death.”

SN.26.9. Dhātusutta (“Elements”)
